intro: Erophila verna var. hirtella, commonly known as hairy spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Erophila verna var. hirtella is an early bloomer, often appearing in late spring.
